p: The conservation priority areas with both the greatest precipitation change (either area or percent) and high population change (> 60% or > 25 people/ km 2) were the Himalaya hotspot and Western Himalaya temperate forest G200, the Horn of Africa Hotspot and Horn of Africa Acacia Savanna G200, the East African Coastal Forest Hotspot and G200, and the Western Ghats and Sri Lanka Hotspot and overlapping Sri Lankan Moist Forest and Southwestern Ghats Moist Forest G200 regions. The non-overlapping conservation priorities include the Indo-Burma, Sundaland, and Philippines Hotspots as well as the Southwestern Amazonian Moist Forest, and Northern Australia and Trans-Fly savannas. The Mediterranean Basin, Mesoamerica, and Eastern Afromontane Hotspots also had high precipitation change ( Fig 2).
